intro: Lindernia sudanica, commonly known as Sudanese lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the Sahel region of Africa. It belongs to the family Linderniaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in dense spikes, often in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to poor soils and drought conditions. Lindernia sudanica is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, contributing to local biodiversity.
